intro: Dombeya linearifolia subsp. muricata, commonly known as the roughleaf dombeya, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in small, rough projections, giving it a textured appearance. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
